alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 6:32PM CDT until July 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen so far. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over parts of the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Childersburg, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Indian Springs Village, Vincent, Harpersville, Westover, Wilton, Oak Mountain State Park, Shelby County Airport, Oak Mountain Amphitheater, American Village, Maylene and University Of Montevallo.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
